title: Spack spec glib fails
body:
The spec can be normalized but it seems that concretization fails with parser error. I tried running

```
spack --debug spec glib
```

to get more info and it looks like the problem is internally in spack:

```
Input spec
------------------------------
  glib

Normalized
------------------------------
  glib
      ^libffi
      ^pkg-config
      ^zlib

Concretized
------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/sw/eos/.spack/bin/spack", line 154, in main
    return_val = command(parser, args)
  File "/autofs/nccs-svm1_sw/eos/.spack/lib/spack/spack/cmd/spec.py", line 58, in spec
    spec.concretize()
  File "/autofs/nccs-svm1_sw/eos/.spack/lib/spack/spack/spec.py", line 1039, in concretize
    self._expand_virtual_packages(),
  File "/autofs/nccs-svm1_sw/eos/.spack/lib/spack/spack/spec.py", line 959, in _expand_virtual_packages
    spec)
  File "/autofs/nccs-svm1_sw/eos/.spack/lib/spack/spack/concretize.py", line 110, in choose_virtual_or_external
    candidates = self._valid_virtuals_and_externals(spec)
  File "/autofs/nccs-svm1_sw/eos/.spack/lib/spack/spack/concretize.py", line 76, in _valid_virtuals_and_externals
    externals = spec_externals(cspec)
  File "/autofs/nccs-svm1_sw/eos/.spack/lib/spack/spack/config.py", line 678, in spec_externals
    external_spec = spack.spec.Spec(external_spec, external=path)
  File "/autofs/nccs-svm1_sw/eos/.spack/lib/spack/spack/spec.py", line 459, in __init__
    spec_list = SpecParser().parse(spec_like)
  File "/autofs/nccs-svm1_sw/eos/.spack/lib/spack/spack/parse.py", line 124, in parse
    return self.do_parse()
  File "/autofs/nccs-svm1_sw/eos/.spack/lib/spack/spack/spec.py", line 2068, in do_parse
    raise SpecParseError(e)
spack.spec.SpecParseError: Unexpected token
```
